paragraphs.name: fac5
paragraphs.text: Great post. My daughter has two food allergies to egg and salmon. I wanted to help solve this issue we have of finding food that is both safe for her and healthier for us than a default burger and pizza that people gravitate to. My solution was my side project Bestfoodnearme.com it has been up since last year, but I am working to make it look better.

paragraphs.name: 446d
paragraphs.text: Big Food is being disrupted for sure. In some cases it’s running up against government regulation that has no basis in science. I am seeing really cutting edge studies on gut bacteria, and fermented food. Gut bacteria and raw dairy. Yet, if you produce foods like this you are tossed in jail and your assets are seized.

paragraphs.text: Sounds like a great company Mark. I agree that food and health can be fertile ground for great companies. I also have a question in my mind. In the US and Europe we spend massive amounts of money on health. We tend to view this as a cost centre. How could we change the culture and turn this expenditure into a catalyst for innovation? (A bit life Defense spending in SV in the decades after the War)

97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table

paragraphs.name: 4db5
paragraphs.text: We’re not Pollyannaish about this. We believe that it is incrementally harder to differentiate on simple Internet products or mobile apps and while great companies are built doing this, our goal as a fund is to try and fund things that can be 100x returns if they work. In short, we’re after venture returns.

paragraphs.name: b2bb
paragraphs.text: As healthcare costs have risen dramatically in the past few decades we believe that the market will shift to more preventative approaches led by science, data and devices and billion-dollar companies will be created.

paragraphs.name: f586
paragraphs.text: As a market, food allergies are unfortunately on the rise — estimated to affect 15M Americans, food allergies have grown 50% in past 20 years — and food intolerance to gluten, soy, dairy is growing.

paragraphs.name: d120
paragraphs.text: We know to do this we need to fund projects that are more difficult in scope, more ambitious in industry transformation, less obvious in market adoption and a higher probability of not working. We know that to be successful we need to fund truly transformational entrepreneurs grounded in unique academic skills and with the self confidence and ambition to try and achieve results in which the market will naturally be skeptical.
